item.title: Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro Tests Positive for Coronavirus
item.description: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, one of the most prominent world leaders to play down the severity of the coronavirus pandemic, said Tuesday he tested positive for the virus.

item.title: Trump Moves to Pull U.S. Out of WHO in Midst of Pandemic
item.description: The U.S. has notified the World Health Organization it will withdraw from the U.N. agency over President Trump’s criticism of its ties to China, a move critics say will hamper the fight against the Covid-19 pandemic and sap the U.S. of global influence.

item.title: Visit by Mexican Leader Highlights Unlikely Friendship With Trump
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador will hold their first face-to-face meeting on Wednesday in Washington, D.C.

item.title: Zimbabwe's Plan to Save Its Currency: Shut Down the Stock Exchange
item.description: Zimbabwe’s stock exchange had served as a refuge of sorts, protecting the African country’s investor class from surging inflation. Its subsequent shutdown is the latest financial contortion in a country with a history of monetary dysfunction.

item.title: Russia Accuses Space Official of Passing Secrets to NATO
item.description: Tuesday’s detention of former journalist Ivan Safronov follows a string of treason allegations against prominent Russians.

item.title: Europe's Tourist Hot Spots Suffer as Americans Are Told to Stay Away
item.description: From Lake Como to the Louvre, something is conspicuously absent from Europe’s tourist destinations this summer: Americans. Europe’s hotels, restaurants, cafes, beaches, museums and other attractions are reeling from the loss of their biggest spenders.

item.title: Clash With China Presents Political Challenge to India's Leader
item.description: A deadly clash with China in the Himalayas has posed a tricky domestic challenge for Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who has cultivated an image as a nationalist leader and struggled to transform India’s economy.

item.title: Isolated Pope Francis Faces Yet Another Setback in Pandemic
item.description: The world-wide restrictions on public events to deal with the coronavirus pandemic are the latest blow to Pope Francis, whose pontificate has been struggling in recent years to sustain the progressive hopes that the Argentine raised early in his reign.
